ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: How often (Direct Report: do you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they have) someone to relax with?
How often (Direct Report: do you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they have) someone to do something enjoyable with?
How often (Direct Report: do you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they have) someone to spend time with?
How often (Direct Report: do you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they have) someone to celebrate special occasions with?
Social Support - Overall, in the last six months, (Direct Report: did your / Caregiver Report: do you think their) companionship...
Notes: 1= Get worse; 2= Stay about the same; 3= Get better

ElementDescription: How often (Direct Report: do you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they have) someone who will listen to (you/them) when (you/they) need to talk (or communicate in other ways)?
How often (Direct Report: do you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they have) someone (you/they) can share personal information with about (yourself or your/themselves or their) problems?
How often (Direct Report: do you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they have) someone who makes (you/them) feel appreciated?
How often (Direct Report: do you feel / Caregiver Report: do you think they feel) there are people in (your/their) life who really understand (you/them)?
Social Support - Overall, in the last six months, (Direct Report: did your / Caregiver Report: do you think their) emotional support...
Notes: 1= Get worse; 2= Stay about the same; 3= Get better

ElementDescription: How often (Direct Report: can you / Caregiver Report: do you think they can) get information (you/they) trust from other people?
How often (Direct Report: do you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they have) someone to turn to for suggestions about how to deal with a problem?
When dealing with a problem, how often (Direct Report: can you / Caregiver Report: do you think they can) get helpful advice from other people?
How often (Direct Report: can you / Caregiver Report: do you think they can) get good advice from other people on what to do about a crisis?
Social Support - Overall, in the last six months, (Direct Report: did your / Caregiver Report: do you think their) informational support...
Notes: 1= Get worse; 2= Stay about the same; 3= Get better

ElementDescription: How often (Direct Report: would you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they would have) someone to make (your/their) meals if (you/they) could not do it (yourself/themselves)?
How often (Direct Report: would you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they would have) someone to bring (you/them) to an appointment if (you/they) could not go by (yourself/themselves)?

How often (Direct Report: would you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they would have) someone to help (you/them) with (your/their) daily chores if (you/they) could not do them (yourself/themselves)?
How often (Direct Report: would you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they would have) someone to run errands for (you/them) if (you/they) could not do them (yourself/themselves)?
How often (Direct Report: would you have / Caregiver Report: do you think they would have) someone to notice and step in if (you/they) needed help?
Social Support - Overall, in the last six months, (Direct Report: did your / Caregiver Report: do you think their) practical support...
Notes: 1= Get worse; 2= Stay about the same; 3= Get better

ElementDescription: How often (Direct Report: do you feel / Caregiver Report: do you think they feel) left out?
How often (Direct Report: do you feel / Caregiver Report: do you think they feel) that people barely know (you/them)?
How often (Direct Report: do you feel / Caregiver Report: do you think they feel) isolated from others?
How often (Direct Report: do you feel / Caregiver Report: do you think they feel) that (you/they) are alone in (your/their) interests and ideas?
Social Support - Overall, in the last six months, (Direct Report: did your / Caregiver Report: do you think their) feelings of isolation...
Notes: 1= Get worse; 2= Stay about the same; 3= Get better

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) Did you get any help while answering the questions in this section of the survey?
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I did not get any help

(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me use a computer, smartphone, or other device (for example, they clicked on the answers I chose).
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone read the survey to me.

(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me understand what the questions or answers options meant.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me decide how to answer the questions on the survey.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I got some other type of help to answer the questions.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone answered the questions for me, without my input.
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): They told me (in whatever mode they communicate)
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I have observed the action, behavior, or event
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I can interpret their behaviors and/or vocalizations
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Someone else told me
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I have known them for a long time
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I spend a lot of time with them
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): None of the above
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other, specify
(Caregiver Report) On a scale of 0 to 10, how confident are you about your responses?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Social Support - Companionship Subscore - Sum
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater companionship. Sum of (ss_oft_relax, ss_oft_enjoyable, ss_oft_spend_time, ss_oft_celebrate)

ElementDescription: Social Support - Emotional Support Subscore - Sum
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater emotional support. Sum of (ss_oft_listen, ss_oft_personal_info, ss_oft_appreciated, ss_oft_understand)

ElementDescription: Social Support - Informational Support Subscore - Sum
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater informational support. Sum of (ss_oft_info_trust, ss_oft_sggstns, ss_oft_advice, ss_oft_crisis_advice)

ElementDescription: Social Support - Practical Support Subscore - Sum
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater practical support. Sum of (ss_oft_meals, ss_oft_appntmnt, ss_oft_chores, ss_oft_errands, ss_oft_step_in)

ElementDescription: Social Support - Isolation Subscore - Sum
Notes: Higher numbers indicate less feelings of isolation. Sum of (ss_oft_left_out, ss_oft_barely_known, ss_oft_isolated, ss_oft_alone_interests)

ElementDescription: Social Support - Companionship Subscore - Average
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater companionship. Mean of non-missing items from (ss_oft_relax ss_oft_enjoyable ss_oft_spend_time ss_oft_celebrate)

ElementDescription: Social Support - Emotional Support Subscore - Average
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater emotional support. Mean of non-missing items from (ss_oft_listen, ss_oft_personal_info, ss_oft_appreciated, ss_oft_understand)

ElementDescription: Social Support - Informational Support Subscore - Average
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater informational support. Mean of non-missing items (ss_oft_info_trust, ss_oft_sggstns, ss_oft_advice, ss_oft_crisis_advice)

ElementDescription: Social Support - Practical Support Subscore - Average
Notes: Higher numbers indicate greater practical support. Mean of non-missing items from (ss_oft_meals, ss_oft_appntmnt, ss_oft_chores, ss_oft_errands, ss_oft_step_in)

ElementDescription: Social Support - Isolation Subscore - Average
Notes: Higher numbers indicate less feelings of isolation. Mean of non-missing items from (ss_oft_left_out, ss_oft_barely_known, ss_oft_isolated, ss_oft_alone_interests)
